titleStmt.title: Untitled [The Princess of Wales]
titleStmt.sponsor: This project is supported in part by a grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities and the Geraldine W. & Robert J. Dellenback Foundation.

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

msIdentifier.repository: Buffalo Bill Center of the West; MS6, William F. Cody collection

keywords.term: Buffalo Bill's Wild West in Britain
Alexandra, Queen, consort of Edward VII, King of Great Britain, 1844-1925
Mikhail Aleksandrovich, Grand Duke of Russia, 1878-1918

div1.p: The Princess of Wales paid her third visit to the American Exhibition on Wednesday morning last. Her advent was entirely unexpected, and she arrived as early as 11 o'clock. Her party drove up to the entrance of the "Wild West," and were evidently prepared to have a spree. She was accompanied by Prince Albert Victor of Wales, the Princesses Victoria, Maud, and Louise of Wales, Prince George of Greece, the Grand Duke Michael of Russia, Colonel Montague and a number of ladies and gentlemen in waiting. After paying a visit to Col. Cody's tent they passed on to the arena, and the Grand Duke Michael proceeded to shoot a match at clay pigeons with Miss Annie Oakley, making a very respectable score, although he was defeated by the little Western girl.
